brief_summary.textblock:
Prophylactic enteral probiotics may enhance clinical markers and biomarkers of preterm
      infants' health, and may also play a role in reducing NEC and associated morbidity.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study the Safety and Efficacy of Probiotics Use in Premature Infants

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  born with weight＜1500 g

          -  hospitalized within 48 hours after birth

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  present with evidence or suspicion of congenital intestinal obstruction

          -  perforation

          -  gastroschisis

          -  large omphalocele

          -  congenital diaphragmatic hernia

          -  major congenital heart defects

primary_outcome.measure: Calprotectin will be used to determine the effect for probiotics
primary_outcome.time_frame: day1 and day30 of the observation

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.
